title: LA Art Show 2026
description: Latin American Pavilion curated by Marisa Caichiolo explores memory, migration, and identity. DIVERSEartLA section focuses on ecological and social justice themes.
mapQuery: LA Convention Center Los Angeles

title: Oshogatsu Family Festival - Year of the Horse
description: JANM celebrates the New Year with cultural activities while galleries undergo renovation. Part of JANM on the Go program.
mapQuery: Japanese American Cultural Community Center Little Tokyo Los Angeles

title: Act On It! Artists, Community, and the Brockman Gallery
description: Exhibition highlighting Black artists and community activism in Los Angeles art history.
mapQuery: Vincent Price Art Museum East LA College Monterey Park

title: Indigenous Youth Migration Project
description: Multi-disciplinary exhibition focused on Indigenous youth from southern Mexico and Central America separated from families at the US-Mexico border. Created with artist Oscar Magallanes. Includes gallery exhibition, documentary film, and public art component.
mapQuery: Museum of Social Justice 115 Paseo de la Plaza Los Angeles

title: Radical Histories: Chicano Prints from the Smithsonian
description: 60 works by 40+ Chicano artists exploring UFW labor movement, farmworkers' rights, and community activism. Includes new commissioned mural by Melissa Govea.
mapQuery: The Huntington Library Pasadena

title: The Great Wall of Los Angeles (LA Phil Concert)
description: Gustavo Dudamel and Gabriela Ortiz bring together composers to create an hour-long symphonic tribute to Angelenos who shaped LA's history, inspired by Judy Baca's mural. Features original film by Alejandro G. Iñárritu.
mapQuery: Walt Disney Concert Hall Los Angeles

title: LA Climate Week 2026
description: Community-led movement with 75+ diverse events focused on climate action, culture, and equity. Art builds, film screenings, forums, street festivals, and cultural programming across LA.
mapQuery: Los Angeles

title: Independent Bookstore Day
description: Citywide celebration at LA's independent bookstores including All Power Books, Strategy and Soul, Reparations Club, and others. Many host activism-focused events and readings.
mapQuery: Los Angeles independent bookstores

title: Yoko Ono: Music of the Mind
description: First-ever solo museum exhibition by the artist and activist in Southern California. Features anti-war works Acorn Event (1968) and Bed Peace (1969) created with John Lennon. Interactive participatory works.
mapQuery: The Broad Museum Los Angeles

title: MOLAA Summer Camp: Artivism Week
venue: Museum of Latin American Art (MOLAA), Long Beach
description: Youth summer camp week focused on art and activism for change. Bilingual program for young artists combining artmaking with social justice themes.
mapQuery: MOLAA Museum Latin American Art 628 Alamitos Long Beach

title: A Great Day in East L.A.: Celebrando the Eastside Sound
venue: LA Plaza de Cultura y Artes
description: Multi-media exhibition exploring dynamic musical influences of East LA artists with portraits and oral histories. Over 500 albums, instruments, and ephemera celebrating Eastside sound and cultural identity.
mapQuery: LA Plaza de Cultura y Artes 501 N Main St Los Angeles

title: Every Minute Is History: Five Views of Los Angeles
description: Five photographers (Laura Aguilar, Reynaldo Rivera, George Rodriguez, Patssi Valdez, Ricardo Valverde) who expanded Chicano and Chicana representation in Los Angeles through innovative techniques.
mapQuery: Getty Center Los Angeles

title: Confederate Statues & Contemporary Responses
description: Decommissioned Confederate statues paired with contemporary work by Kara Walker, Hank Willis Thomas, and others. Addresses white supremacy and historical reckoning.
mapQuery: MOCA Grand Avenue Los Angeles

title: Native Skate
description: Traces skateboarding's Southern California origins and the importance of the sport in Indigenous communities, especially among Native youth.
mapQuery: Autry Museum Los Angeles

title: One of Us: Portraits and Personal Stories
description: David Blumenkrantz's photography project exploring homelessness in Los Angeles.
mapQuery: Museum of Social Justice 115 Paseo de la Plaza Los Angeles

title: Immigrant Communities Projection Project
venue: LA Plaza de Cultura y Artes
description: Large-scale exterior wall projections exploring ongoing realities faced by immigrant and undocumented communities in Los Angeles. Collaborative project with 4 partner organizations.
mapQuery: LA Plaza de Cultura y Artes 501 N Main St Los Angeles

title: LA Starts Here! (Permanent Exhibition)
venue: LA Plaza de Cultura y Artes
description: Alternative interpretation of LA history from Mexican and Mexican American perspectives. Groundbreaking permanent exhibition addressing marginalized narratives.
mapQuery: LA Plaza de Cultura y Artes 501 N Main St Los Angeles

title: The Great Wall of Los Angeles (Permanent Monument)
venue: Tujunga Flood Control Channel, North Hollywood
description: One of the longest murals in the world depicting California history from prehistoric times to present. Created by Judy Baca and SPARC. Currently being expanded to cover 1960s-2000s. New interpretive bridge viewing station.
mapQuery: Great Wall of Los Angeles Coldwater Canyon North Hollywood

title: The 1960s: A Generation on Fire (Great Wall Extension)
description: Latest extension of the Great Wall of Los Angeles featuring 1960s activism. Work in progress by Judy Baca showcasing the energy of movement builders from that pivotal decade.
mapQuery: SPARC Bergamot Station 2525 Michigan Ave Santa Monica

title: SPARC Día de los Muertos Celebration
description: 23rd annual Día de los Muertos celebration and ritual featuring altars, art, food, mariachis, and gallery remarks. Community celebration honoring the departed.
mapQuery: SPARC Bergamot Station 2525 Michigan Ave Santa Monica

title: All Power Books Community Programs
description: Marxist cooperative bookstore hosting documentary screenings, writing workshops, poetry readings, and mutual aid. Community hub for advocacy work with LA Tenants Union, Street Watch LA, and Say Their Name LA.
mapQuery: All Power Books West Adams Los Angeles

title: Strategy and Soul Bookstore Events
venue: Strategy and Soul Bookstore, South Central LA
description: Afrocentric bookstore focusing on Third World revolutionary movements, Black liberation, and anti-imperialist organizing. Part of The Labor Community Strategy Center. Ongoing talks and readings.
mapQuery: Strategy and Soul Bookstore South Central Los Angeles

title: LA Libros Festival 2026
description: Full day of Spanish-language and bilingual storytelling, musical performances, authors, workshops, books, and community celebration. Free and open to the public.
mapQuery: Central Library 630 W 5th St Los Angeles

title: Art + Activism Summer Program
description: Multi-generational mentorship program bringing together high school students and UCLA mentors to explore intersections of art and activism. Paid internships for youth. Portfolio-building and professional skills development.
mapQuery: Hammer Museum UCLA Los Angeles

title: Del Alma: Latina Portraits
description: Intergenerational group of portraits by LA-based Latina artists exploring cultural identity and diverse creative expression.
mapQuery: Vincent Price Art Museum East LA College Monterey Park

title: sister dreamer: lauren halsey's architectural ode
description: Sculpture park and monument to South Central LA by artist Lauren Halsey. Space for community gatherings including film screenings, musical performances, and lectures. Employs ancient Egyptian iconography to reclaim lost legacies.
mapQuery: South Central Los Angeles

title: Ofelia Esparza: A Retrospective
description: Retrospective of artist Ofelia Esparza's work exploring Día de la Virgen de Guadalupe traditions, family artifacts, and cultural memory passed down through generations.
mapQuery: Vincent Price Art Museum East LA College Monterey Park
